titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the International Syndicate Records
titlestmt.author: By Rosemary K. J. Davis

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 06:20
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The International Syndicate records, which span from 1904 to 1963, contain business records, artwork, printing plates, and other papers by or related to the business dealings of the International Syndicate. The records document the company's output, along with business dealings between newspapers, independent contractors, and International Syndicate. Artwork and printing mats make up the largest portion of the collection and are primarily comprised of crossword puzzles and children's page elements.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 98-108, 120-143: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Rulon-Miller Books on the Jockey Hollow Fund, 2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Artwork, 1904-1955. II. Children's page materials, 1910-1961. III. Crossword puzzles, 1910-1962. IV. Metal printing plates, 1914-1942. V. Business records, 1904-1963. VI. Scrapbooks, 1904-1941.

bioghist.head: International Syndicate
bioghist.p: International Syndicate was a Baltimore-based publishing concern that operated from 1910-1961. The company produced feature materials for newspapers, including crossword puzzles and content for children's pages.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: International Syndicate Records. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The International Syndicate records, which span from 1904 to 1963, contain business records, artwork, printing plates, and other papers by or related to the business dealings of the International Syndicate. The records document the company's output, along with business dealings between newspapers, independent contractors, and International Syndicate. Artwork and printing mats make up the largest portion of the collection and are primarily comprised of crossword puzzles and children's page elements.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The International Syndicate Records is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition with the exception of some oversized materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains original and reproduced artwork, including drawings and puzzles, used in the production of International Syndicate content.

did.unittitle: Drawings and artwork for children's pages
Drawings and artwork for children's pages
Drawings and artwork for children's pages
Copy cuts, original drawings, and proofs
Copy cuts, original drawings, and proofs

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition with the exception of some oversized materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains drawings, puzzles, and typescripts used in the production of International Syndicate "Children's Page" printing plates and mats. Also contains printed page proofs of completed "Children's Page" layouts.

did.unittitle: Junior puzzle folders and dot puzzles

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition with the exception of some oversized materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains printing mats and plates for crossword puzzles and solutions, original crossword puzzle designs and templates, and printed crossword puzzle proofs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 100-110: Materials restricted due to weight and fragility. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains metal printing plates for children's page elements produced by International Syndicate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series are organized by content type, then chronologically within that grouping.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains documentation related to the business dealings of International Syndicate including ledgers, correspondence, and printing samples.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 122-145: Restricted fragile material. Materials are currently in process; access to unprocessed materials may be limited. Contact Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks contain print samples and page proofs of puzzles and articles created by artists and writers working for International Syndicate.
